newsitem.title: UK: UK grain futures close higher on sterling dip.
newsitem.headline: UK grain futures close higher on sterling dip.

text.p: Sterling's bounce around lower levels continued to attract support for UK wheat futures with prices closing just firmer after recent declines.
"The futures market has finally steadied up", one trader said.
Wheat futures closed 0.50 to 0.75 stg up on a turnover of 459 with the exception of the November contract which lost 0.25 stg.
A quiet day for barley saw just 12 lots traded with a gain of 0.40 stg for January.
The afternoon session was comparatively quiet ahead of the EU tender results the effects of which "remain to be seen" as one source said.
The EU granted export licences for 350,000 tonnes free-market soft wheat at 22.35 ecus per tonne and 133,500 tonnes barley at 31.49 ecus.
The Amsterdam milling wheat futures market was neglected.
On the UK cash markets, December feedwheat fetched 98.00 stg per tonne FOB east coast ports and Jan/Mar 100.00 stg.
Trade on the delivered market was quiet ahead of the tender.
"Everyone's working off short books and finding it difficult to draw business," one trader said.
Trade in milling wheat 11 percent protein was particularly thin. November business to Liverpool was completed at around 18.00 stg.
Feedwheat fetched 97.50-99.25 stg Norfolk/Suffolk November and Avon range saw April/June quoted marginally up at 102.25 from 100.00 stg on Wednesday.
